definition.conceptual: The proton-to-Planck mass ratio is a fundamental dimensionless number that measures how much lighter the proton is compared to the Planck mass. Unlike the electron mass (which is a free parameter of the Standard Model), the proton mass emerges from QCD dynamics and is dominated by binding energy rather than quark masses.

alternative_forms.description: In terms of electron ratio and proton-to-electron mass ratio
Approximately set by QCD confinement scale

value.interpretation: The Planck mass is about 1.3×10¹⁹ times heavier than the proton

qcd_origin.description: Unlike the electron mass (a fundamental parameter), the proton mass arises almost entirely from QCD binding energy

mass_composition.quark_masses: ~1-2% of proton mass comes from u and d quark masses
mass_composition.qcd_binding: ~98-99% comes from gluon field energy and quark kinetic energy

qcd_origin.confinement_scale: m_p ≈ Λ_QCD ≈ 200 MeV reflects the QCD confinement scale

two_hierarchies: Why is m_p/m_P so small? (hierarchy between QCD and Planck scales)
Why is Λ_QCD << M_Planck? (related to gauge coupling running)
hierarchy_problem.dimensional_transmutation: The proton mass arises through dimensional transmutation in QCD: a dimensionless coupling g_s becomes a mass scale Λ_QCD

nuclear_physics.nuclear_binding: Nuclear binding energies are ~0.1-1% of proton mass
nuclear_physics.stability: Nuclear stability requires delicate balance involving m_p/m_P

gravitational_effects.no_proton_black_holes: Protons cannot form black holes because r_s << ℓ_P × (m_p/m_P)

origin_difference.electron: Mass is a free parameter (Yukawa coupling to Higgs)
origin_difference.proton: Mass emerges from QCD dynamics (dimensional transmutation)

planck_ratio_comparison.ratio_of_ratios: m_p/m_P is ~1836 times larger than m_e/m_P

cosmological_implications.baryon_to_planck: The baryonic mass scale m_p sets the characteristic mass for ordinary matter
cosmological_implications.stellar_masses: Maximum stellar mass M_* ~ m_P³/m_p² ≈ 10³² kg ~ 50 M_☉
cosmological_implications.chandrasekhar_limit: White dwarf limit M_Ch ≈ m_P³/m_p² ≈ 1.4 M_☉ derives from m_p/m_P
cosmological_implications.hydrogen_epoch: Small m_p/m_P ensures atoms form before gravitational collapse dominates

dimensional_analysis.characteristic_role: Measures the hierarchy between nuclear/QCD and gravitational scales

related_concepts.description: Proton mass set by QCD confinement

primary_sources.title: CODATA Recommended Values of the Fundamental Physical Constants
Lattice QCD calculations of proton mass

common_misconceptions.misconception: Proton mass comes from quark masses
common_misconceptions.correction: Only ~1-2% of proton mass comes from quark masses. Most (~98%) comes from QCD binding energy (gluon field energy and quark kinetic energy).
While m_e is a free parameter, m_p emerges from QCD dynamics. Understanding m_p/m_P requires understanding why Λ_QCD << m_P.

teaching_tips: Emphasize that m_p comes from E=mc² of binding energy, not quark masses
Connect to 2004 Nobel Prize (Gross, Politzer, Wilczek) for asymptotic freedom
Show how m_p/m_P determines stellar structure through Chandrasekhar limit
pedagogical_notes.key_insight: The proton mass illustrates dimensional transmutation: a dimensionless QCD coupling runs with energy, becoming strong at Λ_QCD and generating the proton mass scale without any explicit mass parameter.
